command-line tools

Here a listed the different command-line tools which can be used directly in a command shell.

Documentation is generated using sphinx-click but does not offer a pretty rendering. For a more detailed documentation, please use command --help directly in the command shell.

geometry

Tools to manipulate geometries.

If in REPL, use CTRL+D to exit.

geometry [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

create

Creates a new geometry from .geojson file.

I is the input .geogson file O is the output .ogeom file GEOTYPE is the type of geometry to be created

geometry create [OPTIONS] I O

Options

--geotype <geotype>

Type of geometry to be loaded

Arguments

I

Required argument

O

Required argument

repl

Start an interactive shell. All subcommands are available in it.

param old_ctx:The current Click context.
param prompt_kwargs:
 Parameters passed to prompt_toolkit.shortcuts.prompt().

If stdin is not a TTY, no prompt will be printed, but only commands read from stdin.

geometry repl [OPTIONS]

show

Shows a geometry in a 2D or 3D plot.

I is the input .ogeom file DIM allows to choose between 2D or 3D plot

geometry show [OPTIONS] I

Options

--dim <dim>

2 or 3 for 2d or 3d plot.

Arguments

I

Required argument

translate

Translates a geometry with a given displacement vector.

I is the input .ogeom file T is the translation vector

geometry translate [OPTIONS] I T...

Options

--o <o>

Output .ogeom file, same as input file if not specified

Arguments

I

Required argument

T

Required argument(s)
